adjectives.description: commendatory (comparative more commendatory, superlative most commendatory)

entries.meaning: Serving to commend or compliment; complimentary.
examples: In the yeare of our Lorde .786.  […]  Pope Adrian sent two Lega[ts into] Englande  […]  with letters commendatory vnto Offa king of Mercia  […]

entries.meaning: (obsolete) That which commends; a commendation; eulogy.
examples: To him he adheres, resigns the whole ware-house of his religion, with all the locks and keyes into his custody; and indeed makes the very person of that man his religion; esteems his associating with him a sufficient evidence and commendatory of his own piety.
